title: Toronto Fitness Expo Survey Bias
original_question: During a high-profile fitness convention in Toronto, a new electrolyte drink startup called 'PureHydrate' wanted to gauge interest among potential customers. They placed a large colorful banner at the main exit that read: 'Passionate about health? Take 2 minutes to rate our drink and receive a free $25 premium yoga mat!' By the end of the day, 450 attendees had participated. The results showed that 98% of respondents loved the taste and would buy it. Based on this, the marketing team concluded that 98% of all Canadians will like the drink. Identify the bias.

segments.text: During a high-profile fitness convention in Toronto,
segments.knowledge: Selection Bias - 样本覆盖不足
segments.explanation: 样本仅来自健身爱好者，不能代表不健身的普通加拿大人。

segments.text: They placed a large colorful banner at the main exit that read: 'Passionate about health? ... and receive a free $25 premium yoga mat!'
segments.highlight_text: receive a free $25 premium yoga mat
segments.knowledge: Voluntary Response Bias - 自愿响应偏差
segments.explanation: 只有对**免费瑜伽垫**感兴趣或对健身极其狂热的人才会自愿参与，导致结果高度正面。

segments.text: By the end of the day, 450 attendees had participated.
The marketing team concluded that 98% of all Canadians will like the drink.
segments.knowledge: Scope of Inference - 推断范围错误
segments.explanation: 统计学原则：推断范围（Canadians）不应超过采样总体（Convention attendees）。

traps.title: The Reward Trap
traps.description: 学生常忽略礼品（Yoga mat）对参与动机的影响。这不仅是抽样位置问题，更是典型的自愿响应偏见。

solution.content: 抽样仅在特定展会进行，排除了非健身人群。
solution.source_label: 来自已知条件：抽样地点

solution.content: 通过高额礼品吸引自愿参与者。
solution.source_label: 外部核心知识：Voluntary Response Bias 往往由于强烈的参与动机导致样本非随机。

solution.content: 存在严重的 Selection Bias 和 Voluntary Response Bias，结论不可靠。

title: The Coffee and GPA Correlation Myth
original_question: A university wellness department collected data from 2,500 students. They found a statistically significant correlation coefficient of $r = 0.75$ between the number of cups of coffee consumed per week and the students' Term GPA. The student newspaper published a headline: 'Drinking More Coffee Leads to Higher Grades!' and encouraged students to increase caffeine intake. Evaluate this headline.

segments.text: A university wellness department collected data from 2,500 students.
segments.explanation: 2500 人的样本量足以提供稳定的相关性观察。

segments.text: They found a statistically significant correlation coefficient of $r = 0.75$
segments.explanation: $r = 0.75$ 表明两者之间存在较强的正相关关系，即咖啡喝得多的人通常成绩也高。

segments.text: The student newspaper published a headline: 'Drinking More Coffee Leads to Higher Grades!'
segments.knowledge: Correlation vs. Causation - 相关非因果
segments.explanation: 关键词 **'Leads to'** 错误地暗示了咖啡直接导致了成绩提高。

traps.title: Lurking Variables (潜伏变量)
traps.description: 可能存在第三个变量，如 'Study Hours'。学习时间长的学生既喝更多咖啡熬夜，也因为复习充分而拿到高分。咖啡只是一个代理变量。

solution.source_label: 来自已知条件：$r$ 的取值

solution.content: 相关性不等于因果性（Correlation is not Causation）。
solution.source_label: 外部核心知识：在观察性研究中，必须考虑潜伏变量的影响。

solution.content: 校报的标题严重误导，咖啡可能并非提高成绩的直接原因。
